Identify Weather Cue Windows Using Threshold-Based Peak Detection

Source: R/runing_peak_detection.R
runing_peak_detection.Rd

This function identifies potential weather cue windows from climate data using a thresholding algorithm applied to the product of slope and R² values obtained from a prior CSP (climate sensitivity profile) analysis. Peaks are identified when this product exceeds a specified threshold of deviation from a moving average.

runing_peak_detection(
  lag = 100,
  threshold = 3,
  influence = 0,
  tolerancedays = 7,
  refday = 305,
  lastdays = 600,
  rollwin = 1,
  siteforsub = "longitude=-0.15_latitude=50.85",
  climate_data = climate_data,
  Results_days = Results_days,
  bio_data = bio_data,
  yearneed = 2,
  formula_model = formula("log.seed ~ TMEAN"),
  model_type = "lm"
)

Arguments

lag

Integer. The number of past observations used to compute the rolling mean and standard deviation in the thresholding algorithm. Larger values smooth the baseline. Default is 100.

threshold

Numeric. The number of standard deviations a value must exceed the rolling mean to be considered a signal. Default is 3.

influence

Numeric between 0 and 1. Determines the influence of detected signals on the rolling statistics; 0 means no influence. Default is 0 (fully robust).

tolerancedays

Integer. Number of days allowed as gaps within a signal to still consider it part of a continuous window. Default is 7.

refday

Integer. Day of year used as a reference (e.g., 305 = Nov 1). Default is 305.

lastdays

Integer. Number of days before refday to include in the analysis. Default is 600.

rollwin

Integer. Window size for rolling average in climate data. Default is 1.

siteforsub

Character. Unique site identifier (e.g., "longitude=16.71_latitude=53.09").

climate_data

Data frame. Daily climate data, must include a year column and the covariate(s) used in modeling (e.g., TMEAN).

Results_days

Data frame. Output from CSP analysis including slope (estimate) and R² (r.squared) columns for each day.

bio_data

Data frame. Biological data for the site (e.g., seed production), must include plotname.lon.lat, Year, and modeled response variable (e.g., log.seed).

yearneed

Integer. Number of years required for cross-validation or fitting. Default is 2.

formula_model

Formula. The model to fit (e.g., log.seed ~ TMEAN). Default is log.seed ~ TMEAN.

model_type

Character. Type of model to fit. Either "lm" or "gam". Default is "lm".

Value

A data frame with model summaries (e.g., slope, R², AIC) for each identified cue window. If no significant windows are found, the function returns an empty object or message.

Details

The function applies a z-score-based peak detection algorithm to identify the most informative time windows based on signal strength (product of slope and R² from CSP). These windows are then evaluated using linear or generalized additive models over historical climate data.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
result <- runing_peak_detection_site(
  lag = 100,
  threshold = 3,
  influence = 0,
  siteforsub = "longitude=16.71_latitude=53.09",
  climate_data = climate_df,
  Results_days = csp_output,
  bio_data = seed_data
)
} # }
